title: Incorrect phase0 block rewards in rewards API
body:
## Description

The rewards calculated by the rewards API for phase0 blocks have the potential to be wrong in the presence of _attestations from slashed validators_. The reason for this is that the phase0 calculation reuses the op pool's code for attestation rewards, which ignores slashings as an optimisation:

https://github.com/sigp/lighthouse/blob/441fc1691b69f9edc4bbdc6665f3efab16265c9b/beacon_node/beacon_chain/src/beacon_block_reward.rs#L164-L171

https://github.com/sigp/lighthouse/blob/441fc1691b69f9edc4bbdc6665f3efab16265c9b/beacon_node/operation_pool/src/attestation.rs#L149-L152

Altair and later blocks are not affected.

## Version

Lighthouse v4.5.0

## Detail

- Validator x is slashed
- Validator x attests in epoch N with one set of flags (e.g. target + source)
- Validator x attests a second time in epoch N with a different set of flags (e.g. head + target + source)
- Validator y includes both attestations from validator x in a block

## Current Behaviour

The current API will reward the proposer (validator y) based on the flags of the attestation that was included in the block first (i.e. head + target).

## Expected Behaviour

The API should reward the proposer based on the flags of the _best_ attestation included for validator x. This is what the spec describes in `process_attestation` (for phase0).
